predictions.text: Hong Kong authorities will announce at least one arrest or formal charge for bribery/corruption tied to building-code enforcement related to the 2025 Hong Kong apartment-fire case, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Official announcement by Hong Kong ICAC, Hong Kong Police, or the Department of Justice (press release or official statement) confirming at least one arrest or charge explicitly connected to building-code enforcement/inspection approvals linked to the apartment-fire case.
evidence: NYT reporting (2025-12-26) highlights allegations of corruption and weak code enforcement connected to the apartment-fire investigation.
monitoring_signals: ICAC press releases mentioning the fire or building inspection bribery
Hong Kong DOJ case filings/press statements
Hong Kong Legislative Council meeting minutes on the fire investigation
predictions.rationale: High-profile fatalities plus explicit corruption allegations often trigger enforcement actions or headline arrests, though evidentiary timelines can slip past one quarter.

predictions.text: The African Union (AU) will issue an official communique/statement explicitly criticizing or condemning Israel’s recognition of Somaliland, by 2026-02-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: AU Commission, AU Peace and Security Council, or AU Chair issues a public statement/communique that names Israel and Somaliland and frames the recognition negatively (e.g., condemns, criticizes, or calls it a violation of Somalia’s territorial integrity).
evidence: NYT reporting (2025-12-26) describes potential diplomatic backlash and regional alignment shifts after Israel’s recognition of Somaliland.
monitoring_signals: AU PSC communiques schedule and releases
Somalia MFA statements requesting AU action
Reuters/AP reporting on AU diplomatic reactions
predictions.rationale: Somalia’s territorial-integrity issue is a recurring AU stance; a prompt, formal AU response is plausible given the sensitivity and precedent.

predictions.text: OFAC will announce a Russia-related sanctions package designating at least 30 individuals/entities in a single action (same press release/date), by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: U.S. Treasury/OFAC press release or OFAC update lists ≥30 new Russia program (or Russia-related) SDN designations on the same date, tied to Russia/Ukraine conflict or Russian state support networks.
evidence: NYT reporting (2025-12-26) indicates Republican senators pushing for a tougher stance on Putin, increasing odds of additional sanctions.
monitoring_signals: OFAC press releases and SDN updates
Congressional letters/public statements calling for sanctions
White House/National Security Council readouts mentioning sanctions
predictions.rationale: Sanctions are a flexible policy lever and can be rolled out quickly; the size threshold (30) is material but historically achievable.

predictions.text: A California state wealth-tax bill will be introduced that proposes an annual tax rate of at least 1.0% on individual net worth, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A bill is filed in the California Assembly or Senate (LegInfo) whose text includes (a) an annual wealth tax and (b) a top marginal rate ≥1.0% applied to net worth (or worldwide wealth) above a stated threshold.
evidence: NYT reporting (2025-12-26) notes revived California wealth-tax discussion and capital-flight concerns among high earners.
monitoring_signals: California LegInfo bill filings and summaries
Statements from Assembly/Senate leadership and committee agendas
Reports from Sacramento-based outlets (e.g., CalMatters) on wealth-tax drafts
predictions.rationale: Repeated prior attempts plus renewed public debate raise introduction odds, though passage is substantially harder than introduction.

predictions.text: An investor will file a Schedule 13D disclosing beneficial ownership of at least 5.0% of Target Corp. (TGT), by 2026-02-28 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: SEC EDGAR shows a Schedule 13D (not 13G) for Target (CIK of Target Corp.) reporting ≥5.0% beneficial ownership, filed on or before the deadline.
evidence: MarketWatch reporting (2025-12-26) cites significant new investment interest in Target.
monitoring_signals: EDGAR new 13D filings for TGT
13G-to-13D conversions by large holders
News reports naming specific funds accumulating shares
predictions.rationale: A 13D implies activism/intent; the reported interest could culminate in a stake disclosure, but many accumulations remain below 5% or use 13G.

predictions.text: Oracle will reduce or defer previously communicated FY2026 capital-expenditure plans by at least $1.0 billion, as stated in an earnings release/call or SEC filing, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: In an Oracle earnings release, earnings-call transcript, 10-Q, or 8-K, Oracle explicitly revises FY2026 capex (or data-center investment) guidance downward by ≥$1.0B versus a prior stated figure, or states a ≥$1.0B deferral into a later fiscal period.
evidence: CNBC reporting (2025-12-26) highlights investor concerns about Oracle’s AI build-out strategy and execution.
monitoring_signals: Oracle quarterly earnings releases and guidance language
Capex line items in Oracle cash-flow statements
Management commentary on data-center build timelines and procurement
predictions.rationale: If execution/returns disappoint, capex pacing is a common adjustment lever; however, competitive pressure may keep spend elevated.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Education will publish a Federal Register Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) for a new or revised income-driven repayment (IDR) plan, by 2026-05-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Federal Register publication by ED containing an NPRM that proposes creating, replacing, or materially revising an IDR plan (e.g., payment formula, forgiveness terms, eligibility), explicitly labeled as proposed rulemaking.
evidence: CNBC reporting (2025-12-26) notes court-related denials impacting new IDR options, increasing pressure for replacement pathways.
monitoring_signals: Federal Register searches for ED/Student Aid NPRMs
ED press releases on repayment plan changes
OMB/OIRA regulatory agenda entries for ED student-loan rules
predictions.rationale: If courts constrain existing programs, ED typically pivots to formal rulemaking; timing is plausible within 5 months but depends on administration priorities.

predictions.text: U.S. CPI ‘Shelter’ (BLS) will fall to 3.0% year-over-year or lower in at least one monthly CPI release, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Any BLS CPI report (monthly release) shows the 12-month percent change for the CPI shelter index at ≤3.0% (not seasonally adjusted YoY).
evidence: CNBC reporting (2025-12-26) indicates rents falling in several large U.S. cities heading into 2026, implying easing shelter inflation with lags.
monitoring_signals: Monthly BLS CPI tables (shelter 12-month change)
Private rent indices (Zillow, Apartment List) trend persistence
OER vs. rent-of-primary-residence divergence
predictions.rationale: Shelter disinflation is lagged and sticky; falling market rents help, but reaching ≤3% may require broad-based cooling and time.

predictions.text: The FTC or DOJ will open a publicly confirmed antitrust investigation (second request, civil investigative demand, or formal inquiry acknowledged in filings) into an AI-accelerator-related acquisition or strategic investment announced in 2026, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A company involved in an AI-accelerator (GPU/ASIC/NPU) acquisition/investment announced in 2026 discloses receiving a second request/CID or otherwise confirms an FTC/DOJ antitrust investigation in an SEC filing, press release, or on-record regulator statement by the deadline.
evidence: CNBC reporting (2025-12-26) underscores heightened antitrust sensitivity around AI accelerator platform power and deal structuring.
monitoring_signals: SEC filings disclosing HSR second requests/CIDs
FTC/DOJ public remarks on AI compute competition
Reuters/Bloomberg deal reporting on accelerator startups and vertical integration
predictions.rationale: Regulators are increasingly focused on AI compute concentration; some 2026 transaction is likely to attract formal scrutiny, though public confirmation isn’t guaranteed.

predictions.text: A peer-reviewed paper will report independent replication of superconductivity in a newly reported ‘rule-breaking’ superconductor material at a transition temperature of at least 77 K, published by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A peer-reviewed journal article (not preprint only) explicitly frames itself as an independent replication/verification study and reports a superconducting transition (e.g., zero resistance and/or Meissner effect evidence) with Tc ≥77 K in the specific newly reported material/system.
evidence: ScienceDaily summary (2025-12-25) highlights a ‘new rule-breaking superconductor’ among multiple advances, suggesting follow-on validation attempts.
monitoring_signals: Follow-up publications in Nature/Science/PRL/PRB and specialized superconductivity journals
Conference abstracts reporting replication attempts (APS March Meeting, MRS)
Retractions/corrections or replication controversies around the original claim
predictions.rationale: Replication is common but often slower than expected; setting a high Tc threshold (≥77 K) makes success less likely within one year.
